A car carrying American Earth First! activists Judi Bari and Darryl Cherney explodes in Oakland, California , critically injuring both.
Buckingham Palace announces the engagement of The Prince of Wales and Lady Diana Spencer .
The first successful adding machine in the United States is patented by William Seward Burroughs .
Ripple Rock , an underwater threat to navigation in the Seymour Narrows in Canada is destroyed in one of the largest non-nuclear controlled explosions of the time.
The RMS Queen Elizabeth is destroyed by fire in Victoria Harbour , Hong Kong .
The Jefferson Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C. , on the 200th anniversary of Thomas Jefferson 's birth.
Great Depression : The United States Congress begins its first 100 days of enacting New Deal legislation. President Franklin D. Roosevelt submits the Emergency Banking Act to the Congress.
In Japan , the Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge linking Shikoku with Honshū and costing about $3.8 billion USD , opens to traffic, becoming the largest suspension bridge in the world.
In Montgomery, Alabama , Jefferson Davis is inaugurated as the provisional President of the Confederate States of America .
Bernardo O'Higgins signs the Independence of Chile near Concepción .
